text: {{Infobox writer | name = György Moldova | image = Moldova1.JPG | caption = Moldova in 2010 | birth_name = György Reif | birth_date = | birth_place = Budapest, Hungary | death_date = | death_place = Budapest, Hungary | occupation = Writer | language = Hungarian | nationality = Hungarian | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | awards = Kossuth Prize (1983), Attila József (1973, 1978), and numerous other national honors in Hungary | website = }} György Moldova (12 March 1934 – 4 June 2022) was a Hungarian writer who wrote over seventy books. He is best known for his nonfiction books that talk about daily lives in average jobs in Hungary. Moldova died on 4 June 2022 in Budapest, Hungary at the age of 88.Meghalt Moldova György ==References== ==Other websites== * The writer’s website * Moldova’s (Hungarian) biography on the website of the Petofi Literary Museum, Budapest * Ballpoint: A Tale of Genius and Grit, Perilous Times, and the Invention that Changed the Way We Write Category:1934 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Writers from Budapest
title: György Moldova
